intro: Seseli lobelianum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Seseli lobelianum is often found in dry, calcareous soils and is considered a characteristic species of certain alpine and subalpine regions.
